result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard C. Webb was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Offender-Fail/Provide Information, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(2)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.  Defendant shall comply with the sex offender registration.  Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections.  If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Richard C. Webb in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into record.  Plea of no contest.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty and court orders withheld sentence; probation for 18 months conditions are comply with sex offender registration; court costs and DNA sample and surcharge.  One day sentence credit  - rt

Defendant Richard C. Webb in court with attorney Justin D. Wolff.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waived reading of complaint; preliminary hearing requested with time limits waived; PTC set.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 3, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Taylor County Arrest Header

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall comply with sexual offender registry procedures.
Initial appearance on October 7, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Richard C. Webb in court, in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Warrant quashed.  State requested a $5000  signature bond with booking and comply with sex offender registry requirements.  Response by Mr. Webb.  Court ordered bond as requested.  Advised of right to counsel and notice of right to counsel given to DE.  DE advised to contact SPD immediately.  Initial appearance scheduled for October 7, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Received e-mail from sheriff's department that defendant was picked up on warrant.  - rt
